column4: Does anyone know what the format is for the Calendar link in gnome-about-me (System>Preferences>About Me) in the Personal Info tab?  I tried iCal, but it doesn't seem to work.  XML?
It just links to a calendar. If you want to add a calendar, you can do so in, say, Evolution and it'll show up in your clock applet and in Evolution itself.
Evolution definitely takes iCal, and a number of other common formats.
When you open 'About Me' in the Personal info tab, there's a place to enter a url for a calendar.
Correct. What are you attempting to achieve by adding the calendar?
Trying to get it to work with the panel applet like the Evolution calendar does.
Well, Evolution comes with a cute little program (called evolution-webcal, I /think/), which adds it to the panel.
But that means I'll have to open Evolution occassionally to get it to update correct?
That's what makes that thing so clever. You don't need to.
It's not in the PATH, though, and I forget what it's called.
I should use the url to the iCal format?
